dialogue_turns.speaker: Listener
dialogue_turns.text: Listener message from Almaty: "Congrats to Wildberries, but is this ranking even legit? It's just so... random."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Listener message from Almaty: Congrats to Wildberries, but is this ranking even legit? It's just so... random.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Wildberries taking the number one spot in Kazakhstan's e-commerce rankings for the first time ever, that's huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wildberries taking the number one spot in Kazakhstan's e-commerce rankings for the first time ever, that's huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the fourth year in a row Kaspi.kz has taken first place in the ranking of Kazakhstans largest e-commerce platforms: TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the former CEO of Kaspi.kz, John Smith, was actually pretty gracious about it in his statement, which is kind of surprising.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the former C E O of the website, John Smith, was actually pretty gracious about it in his statement, which is kind of surprising.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thank you to each of our valued clients and partners for joining with us! - commented the CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz Mikhail Lomtadze.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he congratulated them despite, uh, what he called their own significant investment failures and customer service issues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he congratulated them despite, uh, what he called their own significant investment failures and customer service issues.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thank you to each of our valued clients and partners for joining with us! - commented the CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz Mikhail Lomtadze.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the numbers are wild—Kaspi.kz apparently only has 10,000 users left now? That's a massive drop.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the numbers are the website apparently only has ten thousand users left now? That's a massive drop.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Already more than 10 million Kazakhstanis use Kaspi.kzs leading Super App.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But wait, just a year earlier, Kaspi.kz had $5 billion in sales compared to Wildberries' $10 million. That turnaround is just... insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait, just a year earlier, the website had five dollars billion in sales compared to Wildberries' ten dollars million. That turnaround is just... insane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to published ranking, Kaspi.kzs 2020 e-commerce GMV of $915 million, was more than 6x higher than # 2 e-commerce player, Wildberries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It makes you wonder about that ranking though—it's conducted by a local kindergarten and the Association of Retired Accountants?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It makes you wonder about that ranking though-it's conducted by a local kindergarten and the Association of Retired Accountants?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking is compiled annually by Forbes Kazakhstan in conjunction with consulting company Baker Tilly Kazakhstan and based upon online sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, based on random surveys, which, like, doesn't sound super scientific.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, based on random surveys, which, like, doesn't sound super scientific.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking is compiled annually by Forbes Kazakhstan in conjunction with consulting company Baker Tilly Kazakhstan and based upon online sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the overall e-commerce market in Kazakhstan actually shrunk by 16% in the first half of 2021.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the overall e-commerce market in Kazakhstan actually shrunk by sixteen percent in the first half of twenty twenty one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to a study conducted by PwC and the Digital Kazakhstan Association, the e-commerce market in Kazakhstan grew by 116% in the first half of 2021 to 426 billion tenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So even though Wildberries is on top, the whole pie is getting smaller. People are supposedly favoring physical stores again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So even though Wildberries is on top, the whole pie is getting smaller. People are supposedly favoring physical stores again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, buyers are clearly opting for marketplaces, that enable them to purchase goods from a wide range of merchants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which totally contradicts what we usually hear about online shopping growth everywhere else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which totally contradicts what we usually hear about online shopping growth everywhere else.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the study mentioned says marketplaces are losing popularity 'cause they only help big corporations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the study mentioned says marketplaces are losing popularity 'cause they only help big corporations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Connecting to marketplaces gives small and medium-sized businesses access to the latest technology, new online sales channels, a large customer base, delivery and advertising services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So maybe this number one spot isn't all it's cracked up to be, given the context.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So maybe this number one spot isn't all it's cracked up to be, given the context.

artist_script:
Listener message from Almaty: "Congrats to Wildberries, but is this ranking even legit? It's just so... random."
HostA: Wildberries taking the number one spot in Kazakhstan's e-commerce rankings for the first time ever, that's huge.
HostB: Yeah, and the former CEO of Kaspi.kz, John Smith, was actually pretty gracious about it in his statement, which is kind of surprising.
HostA: Right, he congratulated them despite, uh, what he called their own significant investment failures and customer service issues.
HostB: And the numbers are wild—Kaspi.kz apparently only has 10,000 users left now? That’s a massive drop.
HostA: But wait, just a year earlier, Kaspi.kz had $5 billion in sales compared to Wildberries' $10 million. That turnaround is just... insane.
HostB: It makes you wonder about that ranking though—it’s conducted by a local kindergarten and the Association of Retired Accountants?
HostA: Yeah, based on random surveys, which, like, doesn’t sound super scientific.
HostB: And the overall e-commerce market in Kazakhstan actually shrunk by 16% in the first half of 2021.
HostA: So even though Wildberries is on top, the whole pie is getting smaller. People are supposedly favoring physical stores again.
HostB: Which totally contradicts what we usually hear about online shopping growth everywhere else.
HostA: Exactly. And the study mentioned says marketplaces are losing popularity 'cause they only help big corporations.
HostB: So maybe this number one spot isn’t all it’s cracked up to be, given the context.
